prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at origin (0,0,0) with euler angles (0, 0, -90) and translation vector (0, 0.1274, 0). *Sketching face 1 on the XY plane of the new coordinate system:* 1. Draw a line from point (0, 0) to point (0.7296, 0). 2. Draw a line from point (0.7296, 0) to point (0.75, 0.0291). 3. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.0291) to point (0.0204, 0.0291). 4. Draw a line from point (0.0204, 0.0291) to point (0, 0), completing the rectangle. *Extruding face 1 along Z axis of the new coordinate system:* 1. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. 2. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.0109 towards the positive Z direction (normal direction) and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Part 2 Construct a series of rectangles aligned in a straight line, decreasing in size from left to right. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at position (0.0204, 0.1165, 0) with euler angles (0, 0, -90) and translation vector (0, 0, 0) relative to the previous coordinate system. *Sketching 7 faces (face_1 to face_7) on the XY plane of the new coordinate system:* For each face, follow the instructions mentioned below to create the rectangles. 1. Draw a line from point (0, 0) to point (0.0109, 0). 2. Draw a line from point (0.0109, 0) to point (0.0109, 0.0291). 3. Draw a line from point (0.0109, 0.0291) to point (0, 0.0291). 4. Draw a line from point (0, 0.0291) to point (0, 0), completing the rectangle. *Adjust the following properties for each face prior to extrusion:* face_1: Translate the face by (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) relative to the previous coordinate system. face_2: Translate the face by (0.1165, 0.0, 0.0). face_3: Translate the face by (0.233, 0.0, 0.0). face_4: Translate the face by (0.3487, 0.0, 0.0). face_5: Translate the face by (0.4652, 0.0, 0.0). face_6: Translate the face by (0.5818, 0.0, 0.0). face_7: Translate the face by (0.6983, 0.0, 0.0). *Extruding the sketches along Z axis of the new coordinate system:* For each face, follow the instructions mentioned below to extrude the sketches. 1. Set the sketch scale to 0.7092. 2. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.1056 towards the positive Z direction (normal direction) and 0.0 in the opposite direction. 3. Join the extrusions together as the final part according to the design requirements and finish the CAD model.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal, and the height is half the width. **Step 1: Create the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** On the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, draw a rectangle by creating four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point at [0.75, 0.0], end point at [0.75, 0.625] - Line 3: Start point at [0.75, 0.625], end point at [0.0, 0.625] - Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.625], end point at [0.0, 0.0] The rectangle consists of two faces, face_1 and face_2, each having a single loop, loop_1, which in turn consists of four lines. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system's Euler angles and translation vector. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrusion depth of 0.5 (half the width) and an opposite normal depth of 0. The final dimensions of this part will be: - Length: 0.5 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75 Continue constructing the remaining parts based on the provided JSON data. Make sure to provide clear and concise instructions, avoiding specific boolean operation terms and using natural language descriptions instead. Follow the formatting and numbering guidelines for consistency across all parts.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.625]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.625]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top** This part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. It is the base part for the assembly. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** The coordinate system for this part has the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2727, 0.0] 2. **Draw the 2D sketch** On the XY plane of the coordinate system, draw a sketch consisting of one face (face_1). 3. **Create loops and curves for face_1** Face_1 consists of 6 lines: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1364] - Line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1364], End Point [0.2727, 0.1364] - Line_4: Start Point [0.2727, 0.1364], End Point [0.2727, 0.4091] - Line_5: Start Point [0.2727, 0.4091], End Point [0.0, 0.4091] - Line_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.4091], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the `sketch_scale` parameter. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch** Use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system to transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. 6. **Extrude the 3D Sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.2727 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite normal direction to create the final 3D model. This part has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.2727 - Height: 0.75 The next part will build upon this base part.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.2727,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.1364]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.1364],"End Point":[0.2727,0.1364]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.2727,0.1364],"End Point":[0.2727,0.4091]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.2727,0.4091],"End Point":[0.0,0.4091]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.4091],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2727,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width. Begin by creating a new coordinate system as follows: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Create the first sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system with the following: - Create a loop (loop_1) consisting of four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4). - Start point of line_1: [0.0, 0.0] - End point of line_1: [0.75, 0.0] - Start point of line_2: [0.75, 0.0] - End point of line_2: [0.75, 0.5769] - Start point of line_3: [0.75, 0.5769] - End point of line_3: [0.0, 0.5769] - Start point of line_4: [0.0, 0.5769] - End point of line_4: [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the loop (loop_1) to create the 3D model with: - Depth towards normal: 0.1154 - Depth opposite normal: 0 - Scale: 0.75 - Operation: New solid Part 2: A Cylindrical object with a tapered middle section Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The object has a reflective surface and appears to be made of a shiny material. It is centered in the image and is the only object present. Begin by creating a new coordinate system as follows: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2885, 0.2019, 0.1154] Create the second sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system with the following: - Create a loop (loop_1) with a circle (circle_1). - Circle center: [0.0865, 0.0865] - Circle radius: 0.0865 Extrude the circle (circle_1) to create the 3D model with: - Depth towards normal: 0 - Depth opposite normal: 0.1154 - Scale: 0.1731 - Operation: Cut (remove material from previous sketch to create the tapered effect) The resulting CAD model should be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, as described in your input. The hole, which represents the cutout, is located at the center of the prism and is equal to 1 unit in diameter.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.5769]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.5769],"End Point":[0.0,0.5769]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5769],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1154,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.2885,0.2019,0.1154]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.0865,0.0865],"Radius":0.0865}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.1154,"sketch_scale":0.1731,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Create the Coordinate System 1. Define the Euler angles as `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and the translation vector as `[0.0, 0.5, 0.0]`. This will be used to position the 2D sketch plane in 3D space. Build the 2D Sketch 1. Create a new face (face\\_1). 2. Within face\\_1, add a loop (loop\\_1). 3. In loop\\_1, add six lines as follows: a. line\\_1: Start Point at `[0.0, 0.0]`, End Point at `[0.75, 0.0]` b. line\\_2: Start Point at `[0.75, 0.0]`, End Point at `[0.75, 0.25]` c. line\\_3: Start Point at `[0.75, 0.25]`, End Point at `[0.5, 0.25]` d. line\\_4: Start Point at `[0.5, 0.25]`, End Point at `[0.25, 0.625]` e. line\\_5: Start Point at `[0.25, 0.625]`, End Point at `[0.0, 0.625]` f. line\\_6: Start Point at `[0.0, 0.625]`, End Point at `[0.0, 0.0]` These lines form a closed loop, making it the proper basis for creating a 3D solid. Create the 3D Model 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the `sketch_scale` parameter. 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the previously defined Euler angles and translation vector. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch by `0.5` units along the normal vector and `0.0` units in the opposite direction of the normal vector. 4. Perform a New Body Feature Operation, which results in the creation of a new solid body. Describe the Part 1. shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces. The side faces are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The object has a flat base and a flat top. 2. length: 0.75 3. width: 0.5 4. height: 0.75</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.5,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.25,0.625]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>
